get.description: Get Alert summary by severity for the org
get.operationId: Summary Dashboard_Get Alert Summary For Org

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: criteria.alertTypes
parameters.description: If provided, only return summary data for alerts of this type. Otherwise, return summary data for alerts of all types.

parameters.name: criteria.keywords
parameters.description: If provided, only return repos whose titles match this pattern.

parameters.name: criteria.period
parameters.description: If provided, summary data will be scoped to this time period.

parameters.name: criteria.projects
parameters.description: If provided, only return summary data for these projects Otherwise, return summary data for all projects.

parameters.name: criteria.severities
parameters.description:
If provided, only return summary data for alerts at these severities.
Otherwise, return summary data for alerts at any severity.

get.description: Get Combined Alerts for the org

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: criteria.alertType
parameters.description: If provided, only return alerts of the specified alert type.

values.description: The code has an unspecified vulnerability type
The code uses a dependency with a known vulnerability.
The code contains a secret that has now been compromised and must be revoked.
The code contains a weakness determined by static analysis.

parameters.name: criteria.alertValidityStatus
parameters.description: If provided, only return alerts with the specified validity status.

values.description: When there are no validation fingerprints attached to the alert.
When the validations for validation fingerprints associated to the alert have not been conclusive.
When at least one validation fingerprint associated to the alert is exploitable.
When all validation fingerprints associated to the alert are not exploitable.

parameters.name: criteria.componentNames
parameters.description: If provided, only return dependency alerts for the specified package names.

parameters.name: criteria.componentTypes
parameters.description: If provided, only return dependency alerts for the specified ecosystems (e.g., NuGet, Npm, Maven).

parameters.name: criteria.dismissalTypes
parameters.description: If provided, only return alerts with one of the specified dismissal types (closure reasons). Applicable only when filtering for closed/dismissed alerts.

parameters.name: criteria.fixedDateEnd
parameters.description: If provided, only return alerts fixed on or before this date.

parameters.name: criteria.fixedDateStart
parameters.description: If provided, only return alerts fixed on or after this date.

parameters.name: criteria.introducedDateEnd
parameters.description: If provided, only return alerts introduced on or before this date.

parameters.name: criteria.introducedDateStart
parameters.description: If provided, only return alerts introduced on or after this date.

parameters.name: criteria.keywords
parameters.description: If provided, only return alerts whose titles match this pattern.

parameters.name: criteria.projects
parameters.description: If provided, only return alerts for projects whose names are in this list.

parameters.name: criteria.repositories
parameters.description: If provided, only return alerts for repositories whose names are in this list.

parameters.name: criteria.repositoryIds
parameters.description: If provided, only return alerts for repositories whose IDs (GitRepositoryId) are in this list.

parameters.name: criteria.ruleNames
parameters.description: If provided, only return code scanning alerts or secret alerts matching the specified rule names.

parameters.name: criteria.secretTypes
parameters.description: If provided, only return secret alerts matching the specified secret types (rule friendly name or opaque ID).

parameters.name: criteria.severities
parameters.description: If provided, only return alerts with the specified severities. Otherwise, return alerts at any severity.

parameters.name: criteria.state
parameters.description:
If provided, return alerts that are active or inactive based on this value.
Otherwise, return alerts in any state.

values.description: Alert has been detected in the code and corresponds to 'Active' state.
Alert corresponds to 'Unknown', 'Dismissed', 'Fixed' or 'AutoDismissed' states.

parameters.name: criteria.toolNames
parameters.description: If provided, only return code scanning alerts detected by the specified tools.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The maximum number of alerts to return

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: If there are more alerts than can be returned, a continuation token is placed in the "x-ms-continuationtoken" header.  Use that token here to get the next page of alerts

get.description: Get Enablement summary for the org
get.operationId: Summary Dashboard_Get Enablement Summary For Org

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: criteria.keywords
parameters.description: If provided, only return repos whose titles match this pattern.

parameters.name: criteria.projects
parameters.description: If provided, only return summary data for these projects. Otherwise, return summary data for all projects.

parameters.name: criteria.states.anyTool
parameters.description: True if any tool is enabled for the repository, false if any tool is disabled.

parameters.name: criteria.states.codeAlerts
parameters.description: True if code scanning alerts are enabled for the repository, false if disabled.

parameters.name: criteria.states.codePRAlerts
parameters.description: True if code scanning pull request alerts are enabled for the repository, false if disabled.

parameters.name: criteria.states.dependencyAlerts
parameters.description: True if dependency alerts are enabled for the repository, false if disabled.

parameters.name: criteria.states.dependencyPRAlerts
parameters.description: True if dependency pull request alerts are enabled for the repository, false if disabled.

parameters.name: criteria.states.pushProtection
parameters.description: True if pushes containing secrets will be blocked, false if they will not.

parameters.name: criteria.states.secretAlerts
parameters.description: True if secret scanning is enabled for the repository, false if disabled.

AdvancedFilter.description: Represents an advanced filter configuration for the Reporting dashboard.

_links.description: Link references to related REST resources.

changedBy.description: The identity of the user who last changed the advanced filter.

changedDate.description: The date and time when the advanced filter was last changed.

createdBy.description: The identity of the user who created the advanced filter.

createdDate.description: The date and time when the advanced filter was created.

id.description: Unique identifier for the advanced filter.

isDeleted.description: Indicates whether the advanced filter has been soft-deleted.

url.description: The URL of the advanced filter.

AdvancedFilterCreate.description: Represents the data required to create an advanced filter configuration for the Reporting dashboard. Also serves as the base class for AdvancedFilter.

filterCriteria.description: The filter criteria to be applied when this advanced filter is selected.

name.description: User-provided name for the advanced filter.

AdvancedFilterUpdate.description: Represents the data required to update an advanced filter configuration. Only the name can be updated.

name.description: The new name for the advanced filter.

CodeScanningRuleInfo.description: Represents code scanning rule information for filtering purposes.

friendlyName.description: The human-readable name of the rule.

opaqueId.description: The opaque identifier of the rule (e.g., SARIF rule ID).

toolName.description: The name of the tool that defines this rule.

alertType.description: If provided, only return alerts of the specified alert type.

values.description: The code has an unspecified vulnerability type
The code uses a dependency with a known vulnerability.
The code contains a secret that has now been compromised and must be revoked.
The code contains a weakness determined by static analysis.

alertValidityStatus.description: If provided, only return alerts with the specified validity status.

values.description: When there are no validation fingerprints attached to the alert.
When the validations for validation fingerprints associated to the alert have not been conclusive.
When at least one validation fingerprint associated to the alert is exploitable.
When all validation fingerprints associated to the alert are not exploitable.

componentNames.description: If provided, only return dependency alerts for the specified package names.

componentTypes.description: If provided, only return dependency alerts for the specified ecosystems (e.g., NuGet, Npm, Maven).

values.description: Indicates the component is an Npm package.
Indicates the component is a Maven artifact.
Indicates the component is a Git repository.
Indicates the component is not any of the supported component types by Governance.
Indicates the component is a Ruby gem.
Indicates the component is a Cargo package.
Indicates the component is a Pip package.
Indicates the component is a loose file. Not a package as understood by different package managers.
Indicates the component is a Go package.
Indicates the component is a Docker Image
Indicates the component is a CocoaPods pod.
Indicates the component is found in a linux environment. A package understood by linux based package managers like apt and rpm.
Indicates the component is a Conda package.
Indicates the component is a Docker Reference.
Indicates the component is a Vcpkg Package.

dismissalTypes.description: If provided, only return alerts with one of the specified dismissal types (closure reasons). Applicable only when filtering for closed/dismissed alerts.

values.description: Dismissal type unknown
Dismissal indicating alert has been fixed
Dismissal indicating user is accepting a risk for the alert
Dismissal indicating alert is a false positive and will likely not be fixed.
Dismissal indicating user is agreeing to follow license guidance.
Dismissal indicating backend detection tool was upgraded and the alert is not detected by the new version of tool.
Dismissal indicating the affected dependencency is not distributed to end users.

fixedDateEnd.description: If provided, only return alerts fixed on or before this date.

fixedDateStart.description: If provided, only return alerts fixed on or after this date.

introducedDateEnd.description: If provided, only return alerts introduced on or before this date.

introducedDateStart.description: If provided, only return alerts introduced on or after this date.

keywords.description: If provided, only return alerts whose titles match this pattern.

projects.description: If provided, only return alerts for projects whose names are in this list.

repositories.description: If provided, only return alerts for repositories whose names are in this list.

repositoryIds.description: If provided, only return alerts for repositories whose IDs (GitRepositoryId) are in this list.

ruleNames.description: If provided, only return code scanning alerts or secret alerts matching the specified rule names.

secretTypes.description: If provided, only return secret alerts matching the specified secret types (rule friendly name or opaque ID).

severities.description: If provided, only return alerts with the specified severities. Otherwise, return alerts at any severity.

state.description:
If provided, return alerts that are active or inactive based on this value.
Otherwise, return alerts in any state.

values.description: Alert has been detected in the code and corresponds to 'Active' state.
Alert corresponds to 'Unknown', 'Dismissed', 'Fixed' or 'AutoDismissed' states.

toolNames.description: If provided, only return code scanning alerts detected by the specified tools.

DashboardAlert.description: An alert entity used in the dashboard for combined alerts.

alertId.description: Identifier for the alert. It is unique within Azure DevOps organization.

alertType.description: Type of the alert. E.g. secret, code, etc.

values.description: The code has an unspecified vulnerability type
The code uses a dependency with a known vulnerability.
The code contains a secret that has now been compromised and must be revoked.
The code contains a weakness determined by static analysis.

introducedDate.description: This value is computed and returned by the service. This value represents the first time the vulnerability was introduced.

locations.description: This value is computed and returned by the service. It is a value based on the results from all analysis configurations. An example of a physical location is a file location.

projectName.description: Name of the project where the alert was detected.

repositoryName.description: Name of the repository where the alert was detected.

state.description: This value is computed and returned by the service. It is a value based on the results from all analysis configurations.

values.description: Alert is in an indeterminate state
Alert has been detected in the code
Alert was dismissed by a user
The issue is no longer detected in the code
The tool has determined that the issue is no longer a risk

title.description: Title will only be rendered as text and does not support markdown formatting. There is a maximum character limit of 256.

truncatedSecret.description: A truncated/obfuscated version of the secret pertaining to the alert (if applicable).

validityStatus.description: Validity status of an alert. Currently, this is only applicable to secret alerts. In case of secret alerts, the validity status is computed by looking at the liveness results for validation fingerprints associated to an alert.

values.description: When there are no validation fingerprints attached to the alert.
When the validations for validation fingerprints associated to the alert have not been conclusive.
When at least one validation fingerprint associated to the alert is exploitable.
When all validation fingerprints associated to the alert are not exploitable.

DashboardAlertPhysicalLocation.description: Location in the source control system where the issue was found

filePath.description: Path of the file where the issue was found

region.description: Details about the location where the issue was found including a snippet

keywords.description: If provided, only return repos whose titles match this pattern.

projects.description: If provided, only return summary data for these projects. Otherwise, return summary data for all projects.

states.description: If provided, only return summary data for these enablement states. Otherwise, return summary data at any state.

anyTool.description: True if any tool is enabled for the repository, false if any tool is disabled.

codeAlerts.description: True if code scanning alerts are enabled for the repository, false if disabled.

codePRAlerts.description: True if code scanning pull request alerts are enabled for the repository, false if disabled.

dependencyAlerts.description: True if dependency alerts are enabled for the repository, false if disabled.

dependencyPRAlerts.description: True if dependency pull request alerts are enabled for the repository, false if disabled.

pushProtection.description: True if pushes containing secrets will be blocked, false if they will not.

secretAlerts.description: True if secret scanning is enabled for the repository, false if disabled.

alertTypes.description: If provided, only return summary data for alerts of this type. Otherwise, return summary data for alerts of all types.

values.description: The code has an unspecified vulnerability type
The code uses a dependency with a known vulnerability.
The code contains a secret that has now been compromised and must be revoked.
The code contains a weakness determined by static analysis.

keywords.description: If provided, only return repos whose titles match this pattern.

period.description: If provided, summary data will be scoped to this time period.

projects.description: If provided, only return summary data for these projects Otherwise, return summary data for all projects.

severities.description:
If provided, only return summary data for alerts at these severities.
Otherwise, return summary data for alerts at any severity.

projects.description: A list of Project summary data.
A list of Project Enablement data.

ProjectAndRepoInfo.description: Represents project and repository information for filtering purposes.

projectId.description: The unique identifier of the project.

repositoryId.description: The unique identifier of the repository.

ReferenceLinks.description: The class to represent a collection of REST reference links.

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

columnEnd.description: The column where the code snippet ends

columnStart.description: The column where the code snippet starts

lineEnd.description: The line number where the code snippet ends

lineStart.description: The line number where the code snippet starts

openAlerts.description: Total active alerts in the repo.

totalAlerts.description: Total active alerts in the repo.

advSecIsEnabled.description: AdvSec is enabled for the repo.

codeSecurityEnabled.description: Code Security plan is enabled for the repo. Only present for Azure Dev Ops orgs who had enabled Advanced security after billing sku split has went live.

scanTypeMetadata.description: Repo scan type metadata for different scan types.

scanTypeSummary.description: Repo enablement summary for different scan types.

secretProtectionEnabled.description: Secret Protection plan is enabled for the repo. Only present for Azure Dev Ops orgs who had enabled Advanced security after billing sku split has went live.

projects.description: Display reporting for specified projects. Show reporting for all projects if none are specified.

lastScanDate.description: The date and time of the last scan for the associated alert type/repo combination. Null if no scan has been performed.

alerts.description: True if alerts are enabled for the associated alert type/repo combination, false if disabled.

prAlerts.description: True if pull request alerts are enabled for the associated alert type/repo combination, false if disabled.

pushProtection.description: True if push protection is enabled for the associated alert type/repo combination, false if disabled.

enabled.description: Represents the state of the scan type summary property.

VssJsonCollectionWrapper.description: This class is used to serialize collections as a single JSON object on the wire.

api-Version-preview.1.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.1.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.2-preview.1' to use this version of the api.

accessToken.description: Personal access token. Use any value for the user name and the token as the password.

scopes.vso.advsec: Grants the ability to read alerts, result instances, analysis result instances
